Contact
Tòa Nhà Handico Phạm Hùng,
Phường Mễ Trì, Quận Nam Từ Liêm
+84384791190 (Mobile)
anh.nguyenlehoang@outlook.c om
www.linkedin.com/in/yingng (LinkedIn)
Anh L. Nguyen
Commercial Analyst/ Data Analyst
Summary
"The only way to do great work is to love what you do.  If you haven't
found it yet, keep looking.  As with all matters of the heart,  you'll
know when you find it."
• Summary:          
- Native Vietnamese. Strong command of oral and written English,
and a little Mandarin.
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills; as such to build
productive internal relationships and to collaborate with others to
achieve objectives and ensure information flow;
- General knowledge of procedures and activities within own work
area. Ability to relate actual day-to-day work to business priorities;
- Focused on learning the key aspects and duties of the job being
performed;
- Applies research, information gathering and analytical skills.
Handles detailed, structured problems;
- Works on assignments where judgment is required a majority of the
time;
- Works under general direction, seeks assistance as needed;
- Contributes to own team/closely related teams through quality and
accuracy of own output;
- Conveys information in a concise and professional manner;
- Ability to drive root cause analysis to closure, interpret alternatives
and present solutions;
- Experience in managing multiple tasks and workflows;
- Positive, self-starter, initiative-taker, eager to learn;
- Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines;
- Ability to work both self-directed as well as part of a team;
- Strong IT skills in Windows environment (Power BI, MS Word,
Excel, Access, Powerpoint) and Google Analytics Tool;
- Exposure to multidimensional reporting applications as well as
general ledger software.
※ For more information, please visit: vn.linkedin.com/in/yingng/; or
email to hoanganhnguyen3110@gmail.com
Top Skills
Data Analysis
Microsoft Power BI
Microsoft Project
Languages
Chinese  (Elementary)
English (Full Professional)
Vietnamese (Native or Bilingual)
Page 1 of 6
Experience
Fortna
Resource Specialist/ Data analysis
August 2017 - Present 
Vietnam
1. Resource planning and management
• On an ongoing basis, reconcile projected resources and projects.
• Maintain and reconcile current and projected projects in Project Online.
• Support technical issues in Project Online.
• Provide project team resource planning.
• Develop & implement strategic approach to improve the effectiveness &
accuracy of resource planning.
• QA Plan
• Templates on based on opportunity (Example: Greenfield DC has one
template and Retro DC has another) 
• Metric – need to document and process out for the rest of PSO 
• Make sure regularly that all resource planning data is accurate. 
• Data visualization by Microsoft Excel and Power BI 
2. Cost Alignment and Execution
• Staff smaller and more flexible project teams
• Utilize Athletic resources who can spread across multiple projects to
maximize utilization.
• Support proper change control process to assess impact of project changes
in scope, schedule, budget and resource requirements.
• Provide updates through a Project Online Site (SAP)
• Metric – 
 Bi-Monthly Data Collection and analysis on: 
• Team Size to project 
• Feedback from PSO Leadership/Sales Leadership on Effective WP Planning
relative to resources 
Skill required: Microsoft Excel, Power BI, time management, data process
understanding
Grant Thornton Vietnam
Business Analyst
October 2014 - January 2017 (2 years 4 months)
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Page 2 of 6
■ Business Analysis:
- Market research: in-depth research information about the market, clients,
industry etc. in order to obtain critical data for develop marketing solutions;
curious to learn more about the sectors in which the company specialises such
as communications, content creation, professional services and more;
- Applies research, information gathering and analytical skills. Handles
detailed, structured problems;
- Contributes to own team/closely related teams through quality and accuracy
of own output;
- Conveys information in a concise and professional manner;
- Collaborate with Marketing & Sale team in building budget annually; to
support other departments to ensure budget/ rivision process with require
accurate data and information;
- To support Internal Control process implementation: Prepare, develop and
analyze Internal Audit reports, key performance indicators (KPI) for the Firm,
identify trends and exceptions for management’s review;
- Compile data for monthly GM analysis;
- Review strategy and investment effectiveness of business unit for
improvement;
- Evaluate business performance by benchmarking;
- Monitor Sales performance by preparing weekly and monthly reports;
- Assist in conducting the Client Satisfaction survey, Private Equity survey,
Public Sector survey; 
■ Administration:
- Track key data and insights for the business, and to maintain an up-to-date
and accurate database of financial information used by the team to support
client management and acquisition;
- Prepare documents and presentation in clients meeting and workshops;
- Arrange meetings within the team and clients;
- Assist in preparation of Proposals;
- Any other ad-hoc assignments and special projects requested by Superiors.
ANZ
Student Internship
February 2014 - April 2014 (3 months)
Ho Chi Minh city
Commercial Banking Team
•Collect all kinds of bills and check the amount of final payment
Page 3 of 6
•Write meeting minutes after having a staff meeting
•Prepare bank sheet for a transfer
•Make payment receipt and keep it in folder for internal use
•Bookeeping
•Reading and spreading data on financial reports
•Generate risk reports based on financial reports
•Financial Math calculation
•Portfolio management
RMIT Japan Culture Club
University working experience: Account Executive
October 2013 - January 2014 (4 months)
At JCC, I work as Account planner (Program department) and Online media
controller. As an Account Planner, my responsibility includes:
• Working in group with other members to create activities for club’s operation
(at least for 3-semesters)
• Working with Chief Accountant to devise events/workshops that meets the
school’s brief and budget
• Checking and reporting on the events' progress.
• Conducting reports to Project Manager the club activities
and as an Online media controller, mine consists of;
- Keeping all information about JCC is up-dated  and understanding for all
viewers
- Internet searching:
• Looking for information of projects, businesses academic opportunities
related to Japanese, for example MEXT scholarship or job fairs’ information
hold by Consulate General of Japan in Ho Chi Minh City
• Looking around for any Japanese events at Ho Chi Minh city
- News scanning:
• Listing the main topic of news a day.
• Making summary of news from local, international.
RMIT Film Society The Ticket
University Working Experience: Executive Board - External
Coordianator
October 2012 - June 2013 (9 months)
702 Nguyen Van Linh District 7 Tan Phong Ward Ho Chi Minh City
Page 4 of 6
The Ticket was founded in June 2011 by Paul Smith (B. Design), Madeleine
Morris (B. Design), Melanie Casul (B. Professional Communication), Christian
Berg (B. Profesional Communication), and Khoa Nguyen (B. Design).
The Ticket is not just about watching good movies. It’s about understanding
how they affect us, how different cultures understand stories differently, how
the context in which films are viewed plays a large part in our experience of
them. Each week, the nominator of the film gives a short introductory talk.
Then the film is screened, and a post-viewing discussion is held. Discussions
hosted by The Ticket range all the way from from historical contexts, fiction vs
non-fiction and how humans are portrayed in film to the technical aspects of
film-making, production and financing.
In The Ticket, I work as an External Coordinator. As an External coordinator,
I worked with both the external factors (such as RMIT staffs, Student Council,
people from Film Industry, sponsors, suppliers, etc) and within the Film Society
such as Film department and PR & Marketing department. Moreover, this
position is responsible for making plans and calculate the budget for any plan
involving external resources (each semester), submit those plans to the Head
of Executive to get approval; and making deals with other departments to
control all processes are in the right way.After each project/event, the external
coordinator must conduct reports to compare between actual expenditure and
budgeted plans in order to judge the efficiency of those.
• Skills needed for this position could be useful for future career such as PR,
Chief of Finance, Chief of Accountancy, Cost manager.
Hoa Hoc Tro magazine
Part-time Administration staff
October 2006 - March 2007 (6 months)
•News scanning:
-Listing the main topic of news a day.
-Making summary of news from local, international.
•Internet searching:
-Looking for (highlight) information of youth trend (ex. fashion, eating location,
etc)
-Looking around for any exhibitions or events.
•Collect all kinds of bills (ex. rent car, subscription, photocopy, stationary bills
etc.) and check the amount of final payment.
Page 5 of 6
•Check the condition of equipment (ex. ink refill of color printer & photocopy,
paper shredder etc.).
•Write meeting minutes after having staff meetings.
Education
RMIT University
Bachelor of Commerce (BCom, BCA), Accounting and Finance · (2010 - 2013)
Page 6 of 6
